meanings.definition: To change direction suddenly, especially of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The boat had to gybe quickly to avoid the rocks.
meanings.sent2: During the race, the sailor needed to gybe to catch the wind.
meanings.sent3: The sailboat decided to gybe just for fun, surprising everyone on board.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gybe in the wind direction caught the crew off guard.
meanings.sent5: With a swift gybe, the sailboat turned towards the open sea.

meanings.definition: A sudden change in direction, especially of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected gybe caused the boat to veer off course.
meanings.sent2: The sailor's quick gybe helped them avoid a collision.
meanings.sent3: The playful gybe of the sailboat made the passengers laugh.
meanings.sent4: The gybe of the wind brought a refreshing breeze to the crew.
meanings.sent5: The gybe of the sail filled the air with excitement.
